items.text: I often feel like the world revolves around me.
items.rationale: A strong sense of self-importance is a key aspect of egocentrism.

items.text: I believe my needs should come before others'.
items.rationale: Prioritizing one's own needs is a hallmark of egocentrism.

items.text: I often talk about myself in conversations.
items.rationale: Frequent self-referencing indicates a focus on oneself.

items.text: I find it hard to empathize with others' problems.
items.rationale: Lack of empathy is associated with egocentric behavior.

items.text: I feel entitled to special treatment.
items.rationale: Feeling entitled is a common trait of egocentrism.

items.text: I often think about how I can get ahead.
items.rationale: A focus on personal advancement is indicative of egocentrism.

items.text: I believe I am more important than most people.
items.rationale: A belief in one's own superiority is central to egocentrism.

items.text: I rarely consider how my actions affect others.
items.rationale: Ignoring the impact on others is a sign of egocentrism.

items.text: I often feel that others should admire me.
items.rationale: Desiring admiration is a characteristic of egocentrism.

items.text: I like to be the center of attention.
items.rationale: Seeking attention is a common trait of egocentrism.

items.text: I often think about my own achievements.
items.rationale: Focusing on personal achievements is indicative of egocentrism.

items.text: I feel that my opinions are more valid than others'.
items.rationale: Valuing one's own opinions over others' is a sign of egocentrism.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I deserve more than I get.
items.rationale: Feeling deserving can indicate egocentrism but may also relate to self-esteem.

items.text: I often think about how others perceive me.
items.rationale: Concern with others' perceptions can indicate egocentrism but may also relate to social anxiety.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by my own emotions.
items.rationale: Could relate to egocentrism (self-focus) or oversensitivity (emotional intensity).

items.text: I am easily hurt by criticism.
items.rationale: Being sensitive to criticism is a key aspect of oversensitivity.

items.text: I often feel anxious about how others view me.
items.rationale: Anxiety about others' perceptions is indicative of oversensitivity.

items.text: I take things too personally.
items.rationale: Taking things personally is a hallmark of oversensitivity.

items.text: I often feel misunderstood by others.
items.rationale: Feeling misunderstood is a common trait of oversensitivity.

items.text: I am very sensitive to rejection.
items.rationale: Sensitivity to rejection is a key feature of oversensitivity.

items.text: I frequently worry about what others think of me.
items.rationale: Worrying about others' opinions is indicative of oversensitivity.

items.text: I often feel slighted by others.
items.rationale: Feeling slighted easily is a sign of oversensitivity.

items.text: I am quick to feel embarrassed.
items.rationale: Quick embarrassment is a characteristic of oversensitivity.

items.text: I often feel overwhelmed by my emotions.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed by emotions is indicative of oversensitivity.

items.text: I am easily offended by others' comments.
items.rationale: Being easily offended is a hallmark of oversensitivity.

items.text: I often feel like people are judging me.
items.rationale: Feeling judged is a common trait of oversensitivity.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I don't fit in.
items.rationale: Feeling like an outsider can indicate oversensitivity but may also relate to social anxiety.

items.text: I often feel like I need reassurance from others.
items.rationale: Needing reassurance can indicate oversensitivity but may also relate to dependency.

items.text: I sometimes feel like my emotions are too intense.
items.rationale: Could relate to oversensitivity (emotional intensity) or egocentrism (self-focus).
